revisions.rev:
{{Merge from|List of current and future lunar missions|discuss=Talk:List of lunar probes#Merger proposal|date=August 2011}} This is a list of [[space probes]] that have flown by, impacted, or landed on the [[Moon]] for the purpose of [[Exploration of the Moon|lunar exploration]], as well as probes launched toward the Moon that failed to reach their target. Confirmed future probes are included, but missions that are still at the concept stage, or which never progressed beyond the concept stage, are not. The list does not include the manned [[Project Apollo|Apollo]] missions. [[Image:Surveyor_3_on_Moon.jpg|400px|thumb|right|[[Surveyor 3]] on the moon.]] ==Key== Colour key: :{| |- |{{Colorbox|#EFE7B8;}} – Mission or flyby completed successfully (or partially successfully) |    |{{Colorbox|#F2F2F2;}} – Failed or cancelled mission |- |{{Colorbox|#CCFFD9;}} – Mission en route or in progress (including mission extensions) | |{{Colorbox|#FFFFFF;}} – Planned mission | |} *â  means "tentatively identified", as classified by NASA [http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/planetary/tent_launch.html]. These are Cold War-era Soviet missions, mostly failures, about which few or no details have been officially released. The information given may be speculative.{{Update after|2011|06|24}} *'''Date''' is the date of: :* closest encounter (flybys) :* impact (impactors) :* orbital insertion to end of mission, whether planned or premature (orbiters) :* landing to end of mission, whether planned or premature (landers) :* launch (missions that never got underway due to failure at or soon after launch) : In cases which do not fit any of the above, the event to which the date refers is stated. Note that as a result of this scheme missions are ''not'' always listed in order of launch. *Under '''Status''': :*''success'' means that the mission fulfilled its primary goals. In the case of flybys (such as gravity assists) that are incidental to the main mission, "success" indicates the successful completion of the flyby, not necessarily that of the main mission. :*''partial success'' means that the mission fulfilled some but not all of its primary goals :*''failure'' means that the mission did not fulfil any of its primary goals :Other entries are self-explanatory. ==Lunar probes by date== === 1958 === {| class="wikitable" width="100%" style="background:white" ! colspan="2" style="text-align:left" width=15% | Spacecraft ! style="text-align:left" width=11% | Organization ! style="text-align:left" width=17% | Date ! style="text-align:left" width=10% | Type ! style="text-align:left" width=10% | Status ! style="text-align:left" width=24% | Notes ! style="text-align:left" width=7% | Image ! style="text-align:left" width=6% | Ref |- style="background:#F2F2F2" | colspan="2" | ''[[Pioneer 0]]'' | {{flagicon|USA}} [[United States Department of Defense|DOD]] | 17 August 1958 | orbiter | failure | first attempted launch beyond Earth orbit; launch vehicle failure; maximum altitude 16 km | [[Image:Pioneer able.png|50px]] | [http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraftDisplay.do?id=ABLE1] |- style="background:#F2F2F2" | colspan="2" | ''[[Luna E-1 No.1]] | {{flagicon|USSR}} [[USSR]] | 23 September 1958 | impactor | failure | launch vehicle failure | [[Image:Luna 1 1.jpg|50px]] | [http://www.astronautix.com/craft/lunae1.htm] |- style="background:#F2F2F2" | colspan="2" | ''[[Pioneer 1]]'' | {{flagicon|USA}} [[NASA]]/
[[Image:No image.svg|24px]] [[United States Department of Defense|DOD]] | 11 October 1958 | orbiter | failure | second stage premature shutdown; maximum altitude 113,800 km; some data returned | [[Image:Pioneer I on the Launch Pad - GPN-2002-000204.jpg|50px]] | [http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraftDisplay.do?id=1958-007A] |- style="background:#F2F2F2" | colspan="2" | ''[[Luna E-1 No.2]]'' | {{flagicon|USSR}} [[USSR]] | 12 October 1958 | impactor | failure | launch vehicle failure | [[Image:Luna 1 1.jpg|50px]] | [http://www.astronautix.com/craft/lunae1.htm] |- style="background:#F2F2F2" | colspan="2" | ''[[Pioneer 2]]'' | {{flagicon|USA}} [[NASA]]/
